content: You could create a simple filter, search for date prior to a specific date, and move to a new folder. Then, review the folder for any unintended messages to move back, and then empty the folder. Or, if you're confident of the search, have the action message send them all to trash.
creator: davidsk

content: Are you receiving any error messages? ".gov" servers often have more restrictions on email services

content: What are the specifics in the URL the error message is directing you to? It may be blacklisiting your IP address, which is separate from the webmail's IP address.

content: Please be more specific. Generally, when a password is not presented, the email provider sends a request for password, which generates a prompt by thunderbird for the password. If you are receiving error message, knowing that may help
creator: davidsk

content: Add your gmail (or any other) account so the Local Folders location is created. Then, Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, copy the .mbox file from Google Takeout into Mail/Local Folders, remove the .mbox extension, restart TB, find a folder with the name of the mbox under Local Folders in the Folder Pane.
creator: sfhowes

content: Al momento non ci sono alternative. LocalFolders è realizzata da uno sviluppatore indipendente, per cui il suo aggiornamento non dipende da Mozilla. Tra l'altro l'aggiornamento di Thunderbird in un ambiente di produzione non era affatto necessario dato che la versione 128 ESR è ancora supportata. Consiglio questa lettura -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/scegliere-canale-rilascio-thunderbird

content: My suggestion is to let yourself become more familiar with Thunderbird. Although close to the border, the text will stay there. :) The options are to insert some unauthorized customization that someone may offer, or to create a custom HTML template that you would need to use. A simple 'fix' would be to just click the 'indent right' icon on the composition toolbar prior to beginning your message and that creates an indentation for you. I still recommend doing nothing. Welcome to Thunderbird. :)
creator: davidsk

content:
If you are willing to use userChrome.css, put the following CSS in userChrome.css. The following CSS should work for Thunderbird 128.10.0esr on Windows: 

/* left padding in composition window */ #messageEditor {   padding-left: 20px;   background-color: white; }


The above CSS will only affect the way the draft appears in composition window, and will not affect the format of the draft itself. Therefore, the above CSS will not affect the format of the email received by the receiver.

Please see the attached image, which shows the user interface after applying the above CSS.
creator: Yu5tiqX9og

content:
They are basically similar. 128 is an extended support release, with major updates annually, while 138 is a monthly update that always has the latest features. More info here: 

https://blog.thunderbird.net/2025/03/thunderbird-release-channel-update/
creator: davidsk

content:
1. Version 128.10.2esr belongs to Extended Support Release (ESR) Channel. Version 138.0.2 belongs to Release Channel.

2. ESR Channel upgrades once per year. Release Channel upgrades once every four weeks.

3. If you are using add-ons, or if you think you will use add-ons in the future, or if you are not sure whether you will use add-ons in the future or not, I suggest you use ESR Channel. If you are not using any add-on, and you are sure that you will not use add-ons in the future, you can use Release Channel.

Reason: It is a common situation that after upgrading Thunderbird, the add-ons you use become incompatible with Thunderbird. ESR Channel upgrades once per year. Therefore, if you use ESR Channel, the add-ons might become incompatible with Thunderbird once per year. Release Channel upgrades once every four weeks. Therefore, if you use Release Channel, the add-ons might become incompatible with Thunderbird once every four weeks.

4. References: (1) Choosing a Thunderbird Release Channel https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/choosing-thunderbird-release-channel (2) Thunderbird Release https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-release
creator: Yu5tiqX9og
